title: Proving Too Much
summary:
Key ideas
- Proving Too Much is pointing out an argument's flaw in proving an obviously false conclusion.
- The Dark Arts involve using arguments that can't be disproven within a specific time frame of the opponent.
- The noncentral fallacy and Aristotelian view of concepts/objects can be easily used to perform the Dark Arts.

Key learnings
- Proving Too Much is an effective tool to cut complicated issues that may be irresolvable.
- Using arguments that can't be disproven in a short amount of time is an effective technique in debates.
- Proving Too Much can quickly and easily demolish subtle philosophical arguments.

Key questions
- How do you differentiate an argument that can be easily disproven from one that requires more time?
- Is it possible to counter the Dark Arts? If so, how?
- What are other techniques or fallacies that can help in debates, aside from Proving Too Much?
